method: Calculate moles of NaOH using c × V (0.150 mol dm-3 × 23.40 cm3 = 0.00351 mol). Use the stoichiometry of the reaction H2SO4 + 2NaOH → …, so moles H2SO4 = moles NaOH / 2 = 0.001755 mol. Convert the volume of H2SO4 (25.00 cm3 = 0.02500 dm3) to dm3 and compute concentration c = n/V = 0.001755 / 0.02500 = 0.0702 mol dm-3. All significant figures are limited by the given data (3 sf).
